alert.note: Alert for Eastern Franklin; Eastern Hampshire; Western Franklin; Western Hampshire (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 19 at 4:26PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Hampshire and central Franklin Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 424 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Westhampton, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts over 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Locations impacted include... Amherst, Northampton, Greenfield, Orange, Deerfield, Easthampton, Montague, Southampton, Hadley, Sunderland, Hatfield, Northfield, Williamsburg, Huntington, Bernardston, Conway, Shelburne, Leverett, Erving and Shutesbury. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Franklin; Eastern Hampshire; Western Franklin; Western Hampshire
